H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H3243.def: = action by which newborn children drink milk from their mother's breasts

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H5401.def: = action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H936.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H5090.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to journey from one place to the other, whether with force or not

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H7544.def: = state in which the taste of wine has been enhanced by adding a mix of spices

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H8248.def: = state in which objects contain a certain amount of moisture

H6071.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation and probably still relatively fresh; ► used as beverage; ≈ associated with agriculture, joy, and well-being, but also with drunkenness; also used in metaphors for aggression and sex

H7416.def: = a small tree reaching a height of 3-5 m, with narrow, dark green leaves and thorny branches; its has a red flower and produces red round fruits with a hard skin and tightly-packed pockets of seeds inside; ◄ Punica granatum; ► the seeds can be made into wine; the flower-shaped end of the fruit made it an attractive decoration on stone and in the temple; ≈ associated with love, beauty, and sex

H8040.def: = the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H2263.def: = action by which humans put their arms around someone else ► as a greeting, a sign of affection, or during love-making

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H8598.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-10 meters; it has a rounded crown, and bears a round fruit about the size of an orange; in the spring the tree is completely covered with pink flowers, which gradually give way to the green of the leaves as they develop; the fruit can be greenish, yellow, or red. ◄ Malus sylvestris; ► considered both beautiful and refreshing

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2368.def: = engraved object; ◄ made out of metal; ► used to make a mark denoting ownership, approval, or closure of something (normally done by pressing into clay or heated wax and usually attached to a document or letter); sometimes worn on a chain around the neck, or in the form of a ring on one's hand; ≈ regarded as valuable and associated with exclusivity

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H5794.def: = state in which a person, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H7068.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger  for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H7186.def: = state in which an object is firm and stable in shape

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H7565.def: = a sudden burst of brighly glowing light, whose source can be seen (like fire) or invisible (like lightning)

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H3518.def: = process by which a fire comes to an end, either in a natural way or by force

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H936.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H2918.def: = community area of tents or other shelters, sometimes encircled by a barrier such as a stone wall, ► where a pastoral or nomadic people live; ≈ a more temporary and less populated settlement than a town

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H6696.def: = causative action by which humans attach one or more objects to another object that contains an opening ► in order to block entry and/or exit

H3871.def: = flat object with a smooth surface; ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for construction or decoration

H730.def: = evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H8010.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► king of Judah and {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; given the name {L:Jedidiah<SDBH:יְדִידְיָהּ>} at his birth

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H1174.def: = location ► where King {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>} was said to have a vineyard

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5201.def: = causative action by which humans make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H8010.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► king of Judah and {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; given the name {L:Jedidiah<SDBH:יְדִידְיָהּ>} at his birth

H3967.def: = state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

H5201.def: = causative action by which humans make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H1588.def: = a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as a burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

H2270.def: = person that belongs to a group or class of people

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H1819.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H6082.def: = a young male {L:fallow deer<SDBH:אַיָּל>}; ≈ associated with beauty

H354.def: = wild animal, standing about a meter high, that ruminates, and of which the male grows antlers, which are dropped every year; has a reddish fur with white spots during summer; during winter the white spots disappear and the coat becomes darker; ◄ belongs to family of cervidae; ► clean animal and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with strength, speed, and agility; the male is also associated with sexual prowess

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume
